title: Child care provider data

communications.subject: The Kansas Open Records Act Request: Child care provider data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Kansas Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Historical data on all licensed child care providers (active and closed) from as far back as data systems will allow to present. I also request data on license-exempt providers, if available. Specifically, I request the following information as it is available:

1)	Provider name or ID
2)	Street number
3)	Street name
4)	City
5)	Zip code
6)	Licensed capacity for each year (by child age group if available)
7)	Enrollment for each year (by child age group if available)
8)	Provider type (e.g., center-based provider, home-based provider, Head Start, school-based pre-K, etc.) for each year
9)	First license issue (open) date
10)	Most recent license issue date
11)	Most recent license expiration date or close date
12)	Ages served for each year
13)	Hours of operation for each year
14)	QRIS rating for each year (please explain who is required to participate and whether there are financial supports based on rating)
15)	Accepts Child Care and Development Fund subsidies for each year
16)	Accepts other types of subsidies for each year (please list types)
17)	Prices for each year (by child age group if available)
18)	Violation records

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

title: Denny Blaine Park

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Denny Blaine Park
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to the following records related to the proposed children’s play area at Denny Blaine Park and the subsequent decision to withdraw the proposal:

1. Proposal Documentation: All records related to the initial proposal for the children’s play area at Denny Blaine Park, including plans, designs, feasibility studies, cost estimates, and evaluations of potential sites.
2. Funding Sources: Records identifying the private donor(s) who offered to fund the project, including correspondence, agreements, or terms associated with the funding. Any internal communications or memos discussing the source, conditions, or implications of this funding.
3. Internal Communications: Emails, meeting notes, memos, and other communications within Seattle Parks and Recreation that discuss LGBTQ+ or nudist uses of Denny Blaine Park, dated from January 1, 2008, to the present.
4. Communications addressing the decision to withdraw the proposal, including but not limited to interactions with city officials, legal counsel, or other stakeholders.
5. Public Feedback: All public comments, emails, meeting minutes, and survey responses submitted in relation to the proposed play area at Denny Blaine Park.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robin Monks

title: Gay nightclub raids (Seattle Joint Enforcement Team)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to any and all records related to the planning, approval, execution, results, and internal discussions concerning the Joint Enforcement Team’s (JET) inspections of LGBTQ establishments, specifically The Cuff Complex, The Seattle Eagle, Neighbours, and The Lumberyard, conducted over the weekend of January 26, 2024. Additionally, I am requesting records related to the broader activities of JET, as well as internal investigations or communications regarding public and media responses to these events.

Specifically, I request the following records:
	1.	Planning and Approval Documents:
	•	Meeting minutes, agendas, emails, memoranda, and any other records discussing the planning and approval of the JET inspections for January 26–28, 2024.
	•	Documentation of criteria used to select venues for inspection during this period.
	2.	Execution Records:
	•	Inspection reports, officer logs, and written accounts by JET members concerning the inspections of The Cuff Complex, The Seattle Eagle, Neighbours, and The Lumberyard.
	•	Details of all observed infractions, including lewd conduct violations, and any citations issued.
	3.	Internal Communications:
	•	Email chains, text messages, and other correspondence between the Washington Liquor and Cannabis Board, Seattle Police Department, and any other involved agencies discussing these inspections and their outcomes.
	•	Communications concerning public and media reaction to the inspections, including any official or draft statements prepared in response.
	4.	Investigation Reports:
	•	Records of any internal investigations conducted by LCB or JET agencies into these inspections, including findings and conclusions.
	•	Records of complaints or allegations of discriminatory enforcement practices filed by bar owners, patrons, or other parties.
	5.	Regulations and Procedures:
	•	Copies of policies, procedures, and guidelines governing JET inspections, particularly those pertaining to “lewd conduct” or similar regulations.
	•	Documentation of any changes to enforcement policies or guidelines announced or implemented following the January 2024 inspections.
	6.	Result and Outcome Records:
	•	Documents summarizing the outcomes of the inspections, including internal evaluations or reports on the impact of these actions.

If the requested records contain portions exempt from disclosure, please provide the remaining segregable portions of the records, as required under RCW 42.56.210(1). Additionally, please include an index of all withheld or redacted documents, specifying the exemption(s) claimed for each.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robin Monks

title: University of South Carolina FRS reports

communications.subject: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: University of South Carolina FRS reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal years 2023 & 2024.  These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Stacey Brook

Hello Toni,

The Iowa Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) has received your open records request and will be back in contact soon.  You may view the Department's open records policy at Open Records Policy<https://hhs.iowa.gov/initiatives/open-records>.

Iowa HHS attempts to determine if we have responsive records that can be released within 10 business days, but it may take longer based on the complexity of your request or workload and staffing issues.  I'll do my best to keep you updated if we will require additional time on this request.

Please let me know if you have any questions at this time.  Thank you for your request.


HHS Open Records

321 E 12th St., Des Moines, IA 50319

Hhsopenrecords@hhs.iowa.gov

RE:   Confirmation of Request Being Received California Public Records Act (PRA) Request received on January 23, 2025 Reference # R009019-012325 Dear Toni Thompson, 
This is to confirm the California Department of Social Services (CDSS) is in receipt of your request.  CDSS will process your request in accordance with the California Government Code.  Your request has been received by the CDSS as of January 23, 2025, and given the reference number R009019-012325 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Find responses to RFP 20-8007, Facility Management System, issued by California Department of Social Services (CDSS). Proposals were due on 12/18/2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Toni Thompson

title: Number and impact of data center customers (Snohomish County Public Utility District No. 1)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Number of Data Center Customers - The total number of customers categorized as "data centers" or equivalent from January 1, 2019, to the present, broken down by year.
2. Electricity Consumption - The total electricity consumption (in kilowatt-hours or megawatt-hours) attributed to data center customers for each year from January 1, 2019, to the present.
3. Growth of Data Center Customers - Year-over-year growth (in terms of number and consumption) of data center customers from January 1, 2019, to the present.
4. Internal Communications - All internal communications, including emails, meeting minutes, memos, and reports, related to policies, plans, or discussions on serving data center customers, dated from January 1, 2019, to the present.
5. Policies and Guidelines - Any official or draft policies, guidelines, or procedures created, revised, or implemented since January 1, 2019, that address the operation, service rates, or requirements for data center customers.

To assist in processing this request, I am specifically interested in documents, communications, or data related to:
- Power usage and billing structures for data center customers.
- Discussions on accommodating the growth of data centers in the service area.
- Environmental and infrastructure impact considerations related to data center customers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robin Monks

title: USGS communications

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: USGS communications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All communications that include the term "Gulf of America" or "renaming the Gulf of Mexico".

This should include–but not be limited to—emails, notes, memoranda and presentations between USGS staff and between USGS staff and external third parties.

Please include all documentation within the period January 1, 2024 to January 22, 2025, inclusive.

title: Child care provider data

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Child care provider data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Historical data on all licensed child care providers (active and closed) from as far back as data systems will allow to present. I also request data on license-exempt providers, if available. Specifically, I request the following information as it is available:

1)	Provider name or ID
2)	Street number
3)	Street name
4)	City
5)	Zip code
6)	Licensed capacity for each year (by child age group if available)
7)	Enrollment for each year (by child age group if available)
8)	Provider type (e.g., center-based provider, home-based provider, Head Start, school-based pre-K, etc.) for each year
9)	First license issue (open) date
10)	Most recent license issue date
11)	Most recent license expiration date or close date
12)	Ages served for each year
13)	Hours of operation for each year
14)	QRIS rating for each year (please explain who is required to participate and whether there are financial supports based on rating)
15)	Accepts Child Care and Development Fund subsidies for each year
16)	Accepts other types of subsidies for each year (please list types)
17)	Prices for each year (by child age group if available)
18)	Violation records

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Gabrielle Pepin.

title: Pennsylvania Executive Order on "Scandalous or Disagraceful Conduct" (Pennsylvania Housing Finance Agency)

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Pennsylvania Executive Order on "Scandalous or Disagraceful Conduct" (Pennsylvania Housing Finance Agency)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

For purposes of this request, "SCANDALOUS OR DISGRACEFUL CONDUCT POLICY" means any of: (a) Executive Order No. 1980-18 Amended, dated May 6, 2024, 54 Pa.B. 3018; (b) 4 Pa. Code §  7.158.1 ("Personal conduct," providing that "No employee, appointee or official of the Executive Branch of the Commonwealth may engage in scandalous or disgraceful conduct, or any other behavior, on or off duty, which may bring the service of the Commonwealth into disrepute") or (c) any policy, guidance, regulation, or other prohibition against "scandalous or disgraceful conduct, or any other behavior, on or off duty, which may bring the service of the Commonwealth into disrepute."

1. Any records reflecting a complaint, charge, or disciplinary action concerning any violation (or alleged violation) of a SCANDALOUS OR DISGRACEFUL CONDUCT POLICY.

2. Any records reflecting any warning issued to any employee concerning the SCANDALOUS OR DISGRACEFUL CONDUCT POLICY.

3. Any policy, guidance, regulation, or handbook concerning the SCANDALOUS OR DISGRACEFUL CONDUCT POLICY.

This request is limited to records generated on or after May 5, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Confirmation of message sent to PHFA
communications.communication:
Thank you.  Your message was sent to a PHFA representative in our EXECUTIVE division.  If you require a follow-up to your message, please expect at least two business days for a response.







Note: This message was sent by an automated notification system.

Please do not reply to the sender.  There is no account set up for this email address and any message sent will never reach PHFA.



If you have concerns regarding the information you sent or do not hear from us within a few days, please contact PHFA at 1.855.U.Are.Home (827.3466).

*******************
Confidentiality Notice: This email may contain legally privileged and confidential information intended solely for the use of the addressee. If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any use, reproducing or distributing of this email (or its attachments) is strictly prohibited. If you believe you have received this email in error, please notify the sender immediately and delete this email without retaining any copies. Thank you.

Dear Requester,

Please be advised that your request for records made pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right-To-Know Law ("RTKL") [65 P.S. §§ 67.101, et seq.] was logged as having been received by the Pennsylvania Liquor Control Board's ("PLCB") Agency Open Records Office on January 23, 2025.

The PLCB has now started the process of searching for and reviewing records that may potentially be responsive to your request.

Under the RTKL, the PLCB has five business days from the above date (or until January 30, 2025) to provide you with either of the following: a final written response to your request or written notice that the PLCB is exercising its right, pursuant to section 902(b) of the RTKL [65 P.S. § 67.902(b)], to take an extension of up to an additional thirty calendar days to provide a final written response to your request along with any responsive records deemed to be subject to "public disclosure."
Best regards,
PLCB Agency Open Records Office

communications.subject: Your Right-to-Know Law Request Has Been Received by DEP
communications.communication:
The Department of Environmental Protection's Right-to-Know Law (RTKL) Office has received your correspondence. Requests for records will be processed in accordance with the provisions of the RTKL, 65 P.S.§§67.101, et seq.

Requests received by this account after regular business hours(4:30 pm) or when the Office is otherwise closed pursuant to Management Directive 530.17 will be marked as received on the next business day.

Thank you for your Right-to-Know Law submission that will be forwarded to the Agency Open Records Officer (AORO) for processing. 

If you wish to modify a pending Right-to-Know Law request, do not complete another online form. A second online submittal will not modify your original request. Instead, please send an e-mail to ep-dep-rtk@pa.gov and we will assist you with modifying your original request.

Please note that your request is deemed received on the Department’s next business day if:
  •  Your request was submitted after 4:30 p.m. Monday-Friday, 
  •  Your request was submitted during a weekend, 
  •  Your request was submitted on a holiday observance recognized by the Commonwealth, or
  •  Your request was submitted any time Executive Offices are closed as a result of weather or any other emergency.

The Department will contact you no later than five business days from the receipt of your request as to its status. If you have any further questions on this process, please visit the Department’s webpage at:
https://www.dep.pa.gov/About/PublicRecords/Pages/RightToKnow.aspx

Thank you.
